intro: Strychnos micans, commonly known as the velvet tamarind, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain seeds surrounded by a fleshy, orange aril. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or forest understory habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is cultivated in some regions for horticultural purposes.
